title: Naturopathic Medicine Curriculum
description: A website for the State of California, Department of Consumer Affairs, California Board of Naturopathic Medicine
cleaned_text: Naturopathic Medicine Curriculum Licensed naturopathic doctors/physicians have attended four-year professional-level programs at accredited institutions, where they have been educated in the same basic sciences as allopathic or osteopathic physicians. During the first two years of study, the naturopathic medical school curriculum focuses on the foundational biomedical and clinical sciences: - Biochemistry - Human Physiology - Histology - Gross Human Anatomy - Microbiology - Immunology - Human Pathology - Neuroscience - Pharmacology - And more... For at least the final two years of the naturopathic medical program, students intern in clinical settings under the close supervision of licensed medical professionals. Clinical Coursework includes: - Clinical Nutrition - Botanical Medicine - Lifestyle Counseling - Mind-Body Medicine - Laboratory and Diagnostic Medicine - Minor Surgery and Office Procedures - Traditional Chinese Medicine - Pharmacology - Physical Medicine - Hydrotherapy - Homeopathy - Traditional World Medicine Today's naturopathic doctors/physicians blend modern, cutting-edge diagnostic and therapeutic procedures with ancient and traditional methods.
